title: Bug 116744: Dynamic text content type has no effect
description:
When using a dynamic text element to display the contents of a database field with three types of content (HTML text within <html ...</html> tag, HTML fragments not within <html> tag, and text with RTF tags), the report displays the same results regardless of the dynamic text element's Content Type property (Auto, Plain, or HTML). The expected results are as follows:

1) For the Plain content type, the literal content (including all tags) should be displayed.

2) For the Auto content type, content 1, 2, and 3 should appear properly without HTML or RTF tags.

3) For the HTML content type, content 1 and 2 should appear properly without HTML tags, and content 3 should appear literally with RTF tags.
EB:
The report displays the same results whether I set the dynamic text element's Content Type property to Auto, Plain, or HTML.

Expected results:

1) For the Plain content type, I expect the literal content (including all tags) to be displayed.

2) For the Auto content type, I expect content 1, 2, and 3 to appear properly without HTML or RTF tags.

3) For the HTML content type, I expect content 1 and 2 to appear properly without HTML tags, and content 3 to appear literally with RTF tags.

See attached report.
SR:
To reproduce the bug:

1) Have a database field with three types of content:
   - HTML text within <html ...</html> tag
   - HTML fragments not within <html> tag
   - Text with RTF tags

2) Use a dynamic text element to display the contents of this field.
